title: HaxeUp Sessions October 2018
description: HaxeUp Sessions is an online streamed event, which was held 13th October 2018.

videos.title: Haxe autumn report - Simon Krajewski
videos.description:
Haxe 4.0.0-preview.5 release (https://haxe.org/download/version/4.0.0-preview.5/)

main features:
- support Unicode strings properly on all targets
- support for new syntax for key-value iterators and added it to Map
- support inline call() and inline new expressions
- support @:using on type declarations
- support XML literal strings but require them to be marco-processed
- allow enum values without arguments as default function argument values
- reserved operator and overload as keywords

videos.title: Null safety - Alexandr Kuzmenko
videos.description:
Null safety plugin GitHub repository: RealyUniqueName/Safety
- Presentation slides

videos.title: Coconut. Searching the Holy Grail of UI - Juraj Kirchheim
Batched rendering - Dan Korostelev
videos.description:
In his talk Dan Korostelev describes custom rendering optimizations made for openFL 7 in order to provide smooth gaming experience for "Forge of Empires" players.
Pull request with changes reviewed in this talk: https://github.com/innogames/openfl/pull/73

videos.title: Type classes in Haxe - Heinz Holzer
videos.description: In this talk Heinz Holzer explains what Type classes are, how he hacked them into his own fork of the Haxe compiler and demonstrates the possible advantages.
